info.title: TLSCACertificates API
info.description: API to manage tls ca certificates.

get.summary: Get remaining capped resources for TLSCACertificates
get.description: Not stable or officially supported. Get remaining capped resources for TLSCACertificates

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of TLS CA certificates

400.description: Returned when the request is badly formed.

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

403.description: Returned when the user is not authorized to read the TLS CA certificate.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

500.description: Returned when the underlying storage system returns an error.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Specify the sort order for the results.

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: The next_page_token returned from a previous list request if any.

parameters.name: display_name
parameters.description:
Further fields are bound to query parameters and act to filter the result

Customer friendly name for the TLS CA certificate.

post.description: This request uploads a TLS CA certificate. The display_name is the friendly name.

400.description: Returned when the request is badly formed.

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

402.description: Returned when the user's quota of certificates has been reached.

403.description: Returned when the user is not authorized to create a tlscacertificate.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

500.description: Returned when the underlying storage system returns an error.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body of a request to upload new TLS CA Certificate.

400.description: Returned when the request is badly formed.

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

403.description: Returned when the user is not authorized to read the TLS CA certificate.

404.description: Returned when the identified TLS CA certificate does not exist.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

500.description: Returned when the underlying storage system returns an error.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Specify the TLS CA Certificate UUID where `tlscacertificates/{uuid}` is the TLS CA Certificate Identity e.g. `08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22` from Identity `tlscacertificates/08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22`

delete.description: Delete the identified tLS CA Certificate

400.description: Returned when the request is badly formed.

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

403.description: Returned when the user is not authorized to delete the TLS CA certificate.

404.description: Returned when the identified laccess policy does not exist.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

500.description: Returned when the underlying storage system returns an error.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Specify the TLS CA Certificate UUID where `tlscacertificates/{uuid}` is the TLS CA Certificate Identity e.g. `08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22` from Identity `tlscacertificates/08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22`

patch.summary: Update a TLS CA certificate's details
patch.description: Perform a full or partial update of the identified TLS CA certificate

400.description: Returned when the request is badly formed.

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

403.description: Returned when the user is not authorized to update the TLS CA certificate.

404.description: Returned when the identified TLS C Acertificate does not exist.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

500.description: Returned when the underlying storage system returns an error.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Specify the TLS CA Certificate UUID where `tlscacertificates/{uuid}` is the TLS CA Certificate Identity e.g. `08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22` from Identity `tlscacertificates/08838336-c357-460d-902a-3aba9528dd22`

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description:
The mask says exactly which fields are to be updated. This
removes the ambiguity caused by 'zero' valued fields.
https://grpc-ecosystem.github.io/grpc-gateway/docs/patch.html

get.description: Get OpenAPI v2.0 spec for TLSCACertificates

401.description: Returned when the user is not authenticated to the system.

429.description: Returned when a user exceeds their subscription's rate limit for requests.

resource_type.description: String identifying the capped resource type

next_page_token.description: Token to retrieve the next page of results or empty if there are none.

v1ListTLSCACertificatesResponse.description: List of TLS CA certificates (or the next page in a continuing  list request

identity.description: Unique identification for the TLS CA ertificate, Relative Resource Name
identity.title: generated identity for the entry

display_name.description: Customer friendly name for the TLS CA certificate.
display_name.title: user friendly display name for this tlscacertificate

tlscacertificate.description: TLS CA Certificate as base64 string representing the contents of the PEM file
tlscacertificate.title: TLS CA certificate as string representing the contents of the PEM file

v1TLSCACertificate.description: Describes TLS CA certificate in PEM file format.

display_name.description: Customer friendly name for the TLS CA certificate.
display_name.title: user friendly display name for this tlscacertificate

tlscacertificate.description: TLS CA Certificate as string representing the contents of the PEM file
tlscacertificate.title: TLS CA certificate as string representing the contents of the PEM file

v1UploadTLSCACertificateRequest.description: The body of a request to upload new TLS CA Certificate.
